column3: 一位はアメリカ人でした

column4: I'm the weakest person in the world
column5: I, world in, the first weak

column6: Infinitive form: BU conjugted to BI

column3: お一人さま一つ限りです
column4: It's limited to one per customer

column3: 昨日、一つめこぞうに合った
column4: Yesterday, I met a one eyed goblin.
column6: に: Object of verb - The difference between に and を cannot be defined clearly. However, it is said that if the verb has a nuance of direction or motion, the particle should be に. When it comes to “to meet” and “to kiss”, imaginatively speaking, you would move toward him or her.

column3: 一人でカラオケに行きました
column6:
で in this context is meansで destinationに verb. I.e. the means in which you verb to destiation.
Infinitive form: KU conjugated to KI

column3: 一人はアメリカ人です
むすめは、今日初めて一人でお使いに行きました
column4: My daughter did the errands by herself for the first time today
column5: Daughter, today first time alone errands went (to go do)
column6: で in this context is meansで destinationに verb.

column3: 明日の朝、七時に駅で会いませんか
column4: Why don't we met at the station at seven tomorrow morning
column5: Today morning, at seven at the station meet why dont we
column6:
に as an indication of time
で as an indication of location
ませんか - Why don't (we)

column3: みかんが七こあります
column6:
こ/個 is general counter for 3D things
あります is existance / to have

column3: 七人の小人と友たちになりたい
